roleset.name: paperwork
roleset.note: REFILE-V NOTES: Sometimes the against phrase is included in the suit phrase. You'lltherefore need to delve deeper into the syntax to divide the two args. This happens a lot, with something that looks (syntactically) like anargument of "refile" but is actually a modifier of the head NP--really --this is "documents on the pending spinoff were refiled with the SEC" --but the syntax has been bollixed. Use ArgM for all these. (from refile.01-v)

example.name: active
example.text: [David Dinkins]-1 failed *trace*-1 to refile his income taxes.

example.name: lawsuit
example.text: University Patents refiled a suit in federal court in Philadelphia against Albert M. Kligman.

example.name: passivized
example.text: Documents-1 refiled *trace*-1 with the Securities and Exchange Commission on the pending spinoff...
example.arg: with the Securities and Exchange Commission

example.name: with purpose
example.text: A group of investors refiled with federal antitrust regulators for clearance to buy more than 50% of the stock of Rally's Inc.
example.arg: for clearance to buy more than 50% of the stock of Rally's Inc

roleset.name: seek, claim, call for
roleset.note: REFILE-V NOTES: The difference between this and the Arg-4 "purpose" is that in thiscase the paperwork cannot be mentioned. With the roleset id="refile.03" above, thepaperwork need not be mentioned, but can be. Other arguments(refiled-with, refiled-against) will probably be mentioned. (from refile.02-v)

example.text: One or more airlines have refiled for protection from creditors.
